title: Why were the Syndra buffs reverted?
body:
She already has mana problems. Her early game is poor. Her mobility is poor. Her burst requires setup. 

Noone is even playing her. Why are they reverting the buffs. :(

replies.body: We ran out of time in 5.17 and had to make a call on what to prioritize. Syndra was less urgent, and needed more work, than various other champions, so her changes got pushed back. We expect we'll get back to working on her again soon (potentially for 5.18).
Has the Zyra/Sona buffs/changes been pushed back to 5.18 as well or have we yet to see them/you can't really say if or not so you can choose this option.

We've got some time put aside to look at Zyra during 5.18's development, she also got shifted back from 5.17. 

Not sure if we've got anything planned for Sona, can't see her on the current list of 5.18 Live Balance work, but that's not necessarily comprehensive yet.
Were not you going to be taking a look at immobile mages of all kinds? I remember a red post of some sort that said something of the like.
because buffing Syndra means making that abomination viable again.

So your solution is to leave someone not viable. 

That doesn't sound right. I think all champs need to be viable. Even Poppy.

Being immobile does not mean your kit is not overloaded. 

Why is it okay for her to have 3 forms of cc and massive single target burst ?

Annie has an oppressive Stun (aoe or single target) and the boards complain about her all of the time. Syndra brings more cc to the table and more often than Annie does, while at the same time having superior range to Annie.

  I do not hate Syndra (I actually enjoy playing her), I just think that when she is strong enough to be good she will always be the best choice due to her overloaded kit.

Can you please stop saying she has 3 forms of CC as if she's ever going to CC you in three different ways in a combo. She's going to stun you and chain that stun into a slow, that's it. She doesn't stun you, then slow, you, then knock you back. Her abilities are:

Q: damage
W: slow and damage
E: knockback/stun and damage
Ult: damage

Passive just makes those abilities better at what they do over time. What about that is overloaded? Crowd control and burst is all she does and almost every other mage does that, she just has more of her budget in her burst than most mages.

Because she was stupidly powerful and literally every single person on the forums complained about her until she got nerfed.


Now that everyone forgot why she had to be put in this situation, they want her buffed. Then when this happens, she will have to get nerfed _again_.

This is exactly what happened to Elise just now.

There is just no winning with some champions, is there?

Ryze, Syndra, Elise, and so on. Either they get dumpstered or they shit on everyone. I think the real reason Riot takes so long with these types of champions is because they're just done with this shit, and/or having an aneurysm over the complexity of balance with these dudes (which, honestly, isn't that easy).

Riot had stated that they wanted to test more and that this next patch wouldn't be enough time to iron out some changes for her. Maybe in the next patch (5.18) they'll buff her, but I do hope we see some changes.
The "official" reason is that they had not finished changing her passive around.
